intro: Rinorea johnstonei, commonly known as the Bluebell of the Andes, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in clusters, often in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stems. Rinorea johnstonei is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
